body_html: @beniroquai, yes the batch dimension (45 in your case) should be the first dimension. The n-dimensional fft will transform the last n dimension. I don't expect to see axis support in tensorflow any time soon because the GPU kernel implementation seems to rely on the transform being along the last dimensions--but I'm happy to stand corrected.
body_text: @beniroquai, yes the batch dimension (45 in your case) should be the first dimension. The n-dimensional fft will transform the last n dimension. I don't expect to see axis support in tensorflow any time soon because the GPU kernel implementation seems to rely on the transform being along the last dimensions--but I'm happy to stand corrected.
body: @beniroquai, yes the batch dimension (45 in your case) should be the first dimension. The n-dimensional fft will transform the *last* n dimension. I don't expect to see axis support in tensorflow any time soon because the GPU kernel implementation seems to rely on the transform being along the last dimensions--but I'm happy to stand corrected.
